stanza.line: Let those who are in favour with their starsstars
Of public honour and proud titles boastboast
Whilst I whom fortune of such triumph barsbars
Unlooked for joy in that I honour mostmost
Great princes favourites their fair leaves spreadspread
But as the marigold at the sun eyeeye
And in themselves their pride lies buriedburied
For at a frown they in their glory diedie
The painful warrior famoused for fightfight
After a thousand victories once foiledfoiled
Is from the book of honour razed quitequite
And all the rest forgot for which he toiledtoiled
Then happy I that love and am belovedbeloved
Where I may not remove nor be removedremoved
